schedules.title: Cyrano
schedules.desc: Period musical drama starring Peter Dinklage, Haley Bennett and Kelvin Harrison Jr. Swordsman and poet Cyrano de Bergerac is too shy of his appearance to declare his love for his childhood friend, Roxanne. She,meanwhile, is besotted with Cyrano's handsome but inarticulate new recruit, Christian. Cyrano secretly helps Christian woo Roxanne, but a powerful duke also has his eye on Roxanne and wants her for himself.

23/11/2025

schedules.title: Match of the Day : 22/11/2025
schedules.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Nottingham Forest at Anfield and Newcastle United v Manchester City at St James' Park. Liverpool suffered their first defeat of Arne Slot's reign at home to Forest last term, with Callum Hudson-Odoi scoring the only goal of the game. Newcastle were looking for their first home win over the Citizens in the league since January 2019. Plus, Burnley v Chelsea, Bournemouth v West Ham United, Brighton & Hove Albion v Brentford, Fulham v Sunderland and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace.

schedules.title: Sunday Morning Live
schedules.desc:
S16 E14 23/11/2025
Sean Fletcher and Jennifer Reoch host topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.

schedules.title: Prayer and Reflection
schedules.desc:
S1 E10 St Patrick's Roman Catholic Cathedral, Armagh
The Most Rev Eamon Martin, Archbishop of Armagh and Primate of All Ireland, leads an evening prayer service from St Patrick's Roman Catholic Cathedral, Armagh, to mark the 50th Anniversary of the canonisation of St Oliver Plunkett, who served as archbishop there in the 17th century.

schedules.title: Bargain Hunt
schedules.desc:
S62 Guildford 23 and 24 (Series 62-62 Extended Versions)
Eric Knowles hosts from an antiques fair in Guildford, Surrey, and visits a former Victorian workhouse. Experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell assist the teams.

schedules.title: Songs of Praise
schedules.desc:
S2025 The Big School Assembly Singalong
Aled Jones and Kate Bottley host a singalong of school assembly hymns from Victoria Hall, Bolton. James B Partridge joins them to count down the top 20.

schedules.title: Points of View
schedules.desc: S2025 E19 Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes.

schedules.title: Blue Planet II: Into the Blue
schedules.desc:
S1 E5 Green Seas
Footage of wildlife inhabiting underwater kelp forests, including thousands of giant cuttlefish spawning along a restricted area of rocky reef off the south coast of Australia. Males outnumber females 11 to one, which leads to fierce competition. Larger males use brute force to drive off competition, while their smaller rivals use deception by mimicking the appearance of females. The programme also features tiger sharks hunting for green turtles in fields of seagrass and spider crabs trying to avoid predators while they shed their shells.

schedules.title: Kingdom
schedules.desc: S1 E2 As the wet season transforms Nsefu into a lush green paradise, Storm's wild dog pups must learn to navigate their new, flooded world. When their mother gives birth to a second litter, disaster strikes and the dogs' place in the kingdom hangs in the balance. Leopard mother Olimba clashes with her daughter, who is forced to grow up fast. The lion pride's dominance intensifies, with devastating consequences for the hyena clan.

schedules.title: Shaun the Sheep: The Flight Before Christmas
schedules.desc: It's Christmas Eve at Mossy Bottom Farm, but Shaun's seasonal excitement turns to dismay when a farmhouse raid to get bigger stockings inadvertently leads to Timmy heading off to a Christmas market in the back of the farmer's truck. Shaun sets out to get his cousin back before he becomes someone else's present. Animated adventure, with the voices of Justin Fletcher and Marcus Brigstocke.

schedules.title: Dolittle
schedules.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Robert Downey Jr. In 19th-century England, Dr John Dolittle lives with exotic animals as his only company. But when Queen Victoria falls ill, he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to find a cure, with help from his four-legged friends.

schedules.title: Countryfile
schedules.desc:
S2025 Somerset Levels
Anita Rani and Joe Crowley visit the Somerset Levels. Anita joins those caring for this remarkable wetland, helping to revive habitats for returning wildlife, while Joe meets a farming family who've weathered years of flooding to see how they're bracing for another storm season. Plus, Tom Heap investigates the food scams that are stealing farmers' identities.

schedules.title: Kingdom
schedules.desc: S1 E3 Lioness Rita is raising the next generation, but caring for her cubs alone leaves them vulnerable while she hunts. The hyenas' strength is growing, but a flooded den spells disaster and the clan become separated. Seeking a mate, leopard Olimba begins a new chapter, but in her way is her daughter - she has now become her main rival, and only one can remain.

schedules.title: Strictly Come Dancing: The Results
schedules.desc:
S23 E18 Week 9 2025 Results
Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present from Blackpool Tower Ballroom, revealing who is in the bottom two. The professionals perform a group number before the lowest-scoring couples dance off to decide who will be next to leave. There's also music by Lewis Capaldi, and a group of former Strictly celebrities return to the dancefloor to revisit some iconic routines.

schedules.title: Antiques Roadshow
schedules.desc:
S48 E15 Hill of Tarvit Mansion & Garden 3
Fiona Bruce presents the show from Hill of Tarvit Mansion & Garden, Fife, and visits the Wemyss School of Needlework, set up in the 19th century by a local philanthropist. Treasures discovered by the team of experts include a necklace gifted by an African king, a beautiful Lalique clock and a fragile horse and carriage, made from straw.

schedules.title: Prisoner 951
schedules.desc: S1 E1 Drama based on the true story of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe's imprisonment in Iran for six years for crimes she didn't commit, leaving her separated from her daughter, who was just 22 months old at the time of her arrest. In the UK, her husband Richard fights both the British and Iranian governments to facilitate her release. Starring Narges Rashidi and Joseph Fiennes.

schedules.title: Match of the Day : 23/11/2025
schedules.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, featuring Arsenal v Tottenham Hotspur at Emirates Stadium and Leeds United v Aston Villa at Elland Road. The Gunners defeated their north London rivals 2-1 at home and 1-0 away last term, but Spurs had shown signs of improvement this term. Leeds and the Villans last met in the 2022/23 season, when the teams drew 0-0 here and the Midlanders prevailed 2-1 in front of their own fans.

schedules.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
schedules.desc: Former boxing star Chris Eubank and his son Chris Eubank Jr, who followed his father into the sport, are reunited after years apart to confront their fractured past. The film follows the pair as they explore their legacy, grief and the emotional cost of a life in the ring.
